title: Provides that the unregistered domestic partner of Martin McWilliams is eligible to receive benefits under section 208-f of the general municipal law and section 13-347 of the administration code
summary: Relates to making the unregistered domestic partner of Martin McWilliams eligible to receive benefits under section 208-f of the general municipal law and section 13-347 of the administrative code of the city of New York.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2707

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. RABBITT -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Governmental Employees

       AN ACT relating to making the unregistered domestic  partner  of  Martin
         McWilliams  eligible  to  receive  benefits under section 208-f of the
         general municipal law and section 13-347 of the administrative code of
         the city of New York

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Notwithstanding the provisions of chapter 162 of the laws
    2  of 2003, the unregistered domestic partner of Martin McWilliams shall be
    3  entitled to receive benefits under section 208-f of the general  munici-
    4  pal law and section 13-347 of the administrative code of the city of New
    5  York.
    6    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03523-01-1
actClause: AN ACT relating to making the unregistered domestic partner of Martin McWilliams eligible to receive benefits under section 208-f of the general municipal law and section 13-347 of the administrative code of the city of New York
